title: The Solow Model
text:
This report reflected on the Solow model of economic growth, exploring its significant insights and limitations. It highlights the model’s emphasis on capital accumulation, labor, and technological progress as key drivers of growth, while also addressing its shortcomings, such as the exogeneity of technological progress and its limited consideration of trade, inequality, and human capital. By integrating academic readings, this work provides a nuanced critique of the model’s theoretical and practical relevance.

title: Botswana’s Economic Transformation through mineral wealth
text:
This group project examined how Botswana successfully leveraged its mineral wealth-especially diamonds to transform from one of the world’s poorest nations into a stable, middle-income economy. It highlights the government’s effective resource management, investments in social services, and infrastructure development.
The study also explores the risks of overreliance on diamonds and the rise of synthetic alternatives, emphasizing Botswana’s strategic shift toward economic diversification. Through initiatives like Vision 2036 and the Economic Reform and Transformation Plan, Botswana is promoting growth in tourism, agriculture, and manufacturing to build a more resilient and inclusive economy. Below, I have attached my presentation slides




 Back to top

title: Botswana’s Economic Transformation through mineral wealth
text: Presentation Slides

title: Experiences & growth
text:
Throughout my time at university, I’ve actively sought out opportunities to grow both personally and professionally through diverse experiences in work, volunteering, and sport.
As a Business with Data Analytics student at DCU, I’ve taken on leadership roles such as Class Representative and DCU Mentor while being a mentee myself. I have love supporting my peers and fostering a strong sense of community. I am up for anything that invovles learning, growing and helping others.
My commitment to giving back is evident in my helping collagues in need when they need it along with the Ballymunch initiative, where I help adults learn to cook. I also completed the Healthy Food Made Easy community cooking programme, a Heath Service Executive (HSE) led programme within my local community.
My passion for continuous learning led me to participate in Dell Technologies’ STEM Aspire mentorship, while my job has helped me develop strong time management skills by balancing work with my academic and extracurricular commitments. Outside of academics, I challenge myself by joining clubs outside my comfort zone each year from rock climbing and art to table tennis and most recently completing the 11km Runamuck obstacle course. These experiences have shaped me into a well-rounded, motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a drive to make a positive impact.

  My Interests
  + 


  
    
        
          
        
        
          
            Running
            Fitness
          
          Last year, I organised and took part in an 11km obstacle course run (Runamuck Challenge) with minimal training towards It, an experience which was both challenging and rewarding.
          Since then, I’ve committed to regular running and gym workouts to improve my endurance. This year, I’m taking on the 13km Hell & Back obstacle course, better prepared, and rallying colleagues to take on the challenge together.
          2024–Present, Dublin, Ireland
        
      
    
        
          
        
        
          
            Baking & Cooking
            Passion
          
          One year, I challenged myself to learn baking and cooking, which inspired me to participate in the Ballymunch volunteering programme, supported by the Raising And Giving (RAG) society.
           Through this experience, I gained valuable skills and, during my final semester in college, I decided to join the HSE's healthy eating programme, a six-week initiative that ran for four hours each week. I was part of a class of around 11 people from my local community, all learning to cook nutritious meals. Together, we created healthy dishes and fostered a supportive community built on collaboration and shared learning.
          2023–Present, Dublin, Ireland
        
      
    
      
        
      
      
        
          Rock Climbing
          Competitive Sport
        
        I am an active member of the DCU rock climbing club. I find it a fantastic way to go outside of my comfort zone. I mainly do bouldering which is climbing around up to 2 metres to then climb down safely if you can. It is a great way to meet new friendly people who have the same passion.
        Additionally, as part of DCU rock climbing, I competed in the intervertisites in 2024 and came in 3rd place of the beginners females.
        
        2022-Present, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
    
      
        
      
      
        
          Gyming
          Fitness
        
        Regular physical activity is essential for maintaining good health, and I believe visiting the gym at least twice a week is a great starting point. Personally, I prioritize going more frequently, as it not only helps me stay physically fit but also serves as an effective outlet for stress relief and mental clarity. For me, the gym is more than just a place to exercise, it's a space to focus on personal growth and well-being.
        2022-Present, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
  



  Work Experience
  + 


  
    
      
        
      
      
        
          The Baby Academy Ltd.,
          Webinar Moderator
        
        Main tasks
        
  Prepared online classes, provided troubleshooting support, and assisted instructors to ensure smooth sessions.
  Managed administrative tasks in Excel, including tracking class attendance.
  Moderated online classes with up to 500 participants.


        April 2024–Present, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
    
      
        
      
      
        
          KPMG
          Financial Services Tax Intern
        
        Main tasks
        
  Assisted team members and managers with client work, research, and organizational tasks.
  Utilized Office 365 to manage data in Excel, schedule meetings in Outlook, and communicate with colleagues via email.


        June 2023–July 2023, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
    
      
        
      
      
        
          Circle K
          Customer Representative
        
        Main tasks
        
  Worked at the tills dealing with customers for fuel and items.
  Cleaned fuel pumps and stocked the shop.


        June 2021-January 2022, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
  



  Local & Community Involvement
  + 


  
      
        
          
        
        
          
            Ballymunch
            Volunteering
          
          Participating in Ballymunch, a cooking class initiative for parents in Ballymun, has been an invaluable experience. Supported by DCU's Raising And Giving (RAG) Society, this volunteering opportunity has not only deepened my understanding of how to prepare affordable, nutritious meals but has also equipped me with essential skills such as effective communication, teamwork, and collaboration.
          This opportunity has allowed me to engage with my community, share knowledge, and develop practical skills that extend beyond the kitchen and college.
          2023 November–Present, Dublin, Ireland
        
      
    
        
          
        
        
          
            Experience Japan
            Community Involvement
          
          Driven by a strong commitment to volunteering, I had the privilege of working as and contributing to Experience Japan as an Area Leader in the Kitchen Cabinet crew. 
          In this role, I worked alongside dedicated teams focused on two key areas: managing the storage and changing spaces for performers and efficiently reallocating volunteer resources throughout the event. This was a rewarding opportunity to support a vibrant cultural initiative while collaborating with an incredible group of volunteers to ensure a seamless experience for everyone at the event.
          April 2025–April 2025, Dublin, Ireland
        
      
         
        
          
        
        
          
            DCU mentor
            College Involvement
          
          As a mentor at Dublin City University, I had the privilege of supporting a group of Business Studies students as they navigated their transition into college life.
          Through structured teamwork exercises, engaging icebreakers, and collaborative activities, I fostered a welcoming and inclusive environment that encouraged confidence and connection. My role was to ensure that each student felt comfortable, supported, and empowered as they adapted to this new academic and social experience.
          September 2024–April 2025, Dublin, Ireland
        
      
        
        
          
        
        
          
            Class Representative & DCU Access mentor
            College Involvement
          
          Engaging with the college community as a DCU Access Mentor and Class Representative enriched my college experience in numerous ways. These roles not only allowed me to immerse myself in various aspects of college life but also helped me develop a balance between academic responsibilities and collaborative contributions to the student body.
          Working alongside and interacting with fellow students provided a rewarding opportunity to connect on a deeper level, especially as I could empathize with their journey, having once been in their position.
          2023 September–April 2024, Dublin, Ireland
        
      
    
      
        
      
      
        
          Healthy Food Made Easy
          Local community involvement
        
        Participating in the 'Healthy Food Made Easy: A Community Cooking Programme,' a 4-hour-per-week initiative spanning six weeks, was a truly enriching experience.
        It not only provided me with the opportunity to engage with diverse individuals within my community but also facilitated unexpected reconnections with people I hadn't seen in years. This experience served as a valuable reminder of how life's paths can cross again in the most surprising ways.
        2022-Present, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
  



  Licenses & Certifications
  + 


  
    
      
        
      
      
        
          Irish Driving License
          Commitment
        
        Through unwavering dedication and a strong commitment to achieving my goals, I successfully obtained my Irish driving license without the advantage of a family-owned vehicle. Relying solely on my own resources, I navigated through busy schedules, arranged practice sessions on my own, overcoming challenges on my own.
        This journey required persistence, adaptability, and strategic planning. Moreover, the support and encouragement from my community played a vital role, reminding me that while independence is valuable, resilience is often strengthened by the people who uplift us.
        2023–2025, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
    
      
        
      
      
        
          Pearson Vue ITs
          Software Development
        
        Through Cenit College, I successfully completed the Pearson VUE certifications in Python and Software Development. This educational journey provided me with hands-on experience in programming languages such as C#, Python, and SQL. 
        Additionally, I had the opportunity to collaborate with my classmates on various projects, fostering teamwork and enhancing my practical knowledge in software development.
        November 2023-August 2024, Dublin, Ireland
      
    
    
      
        
      
      
        This Section showcased the certificates that spaned over months and years.
        For shorter courses I have done, check out Professional Development!

title: SQL Project
text:
This project was developed during an 8-week course introducing SQL by Girls Code First. Through this course, I acquired fundamental SQL skills and completed an individual assignment covering various topics, including:

SQL coding and database management techniques.
Data analysis.
Analyzing data from complex structures.
Data manipulation with SQL programming language.
Data management using SQL coding techniques.
Database design and data visualisation.
Project presentation.


  

For my project, I designed a database focused on restaurant order management. This involved implementing foreign and primary keys and creating an Entity-Relationship (EER) diagram.

title: ePortfolio (this website)
text:
This project involves creating a professional ePortfolio using predominately Quarto, Git, and GitHub, hosted on GitHub Pages. It allowed me to showcase my technical expertise, academic accomplishments, and professional growth through various sections like a landing page, CV, and coding-based projects. Through this assignment, I honed my skills in web development, utilizing primarily Quarto, HTML, and SCSS and version control, while demonstrating best practices in multimedia integration, usability, and design.
My ePortfolio is now live, deployed on GitHub Pages, representing the culmination of my efforts. Moverover, this repositry can be found by following the link above.

title: Fruit Basket Project
text:
This project was developed during an 8-week introduction to JavaScript course offered by Girls Code First. Throughout the course, I gained proficiency in JavaScript fundamentals and collaborated on a group project covering various topics, including:

Conditional logical and functions.
Arrays and loops.
JavaScript for websites: DOM part 1.
JavaScript for websites: DOM part 2.
Project Initiation.
Building your app.
Project Presentation.

Our final pair, a fruit shop basket, was completed within a 2-week deadline.
In this project, a interactive shopping experience was created. Upon entering the interface, users are greeted by their name and prompted to give an item they would like to purchase. If an item is unavailable, an apology message is displayed. Furthermore, the shop dynamically calculates the contents of the user’s basket.


 Back to top

title: Product Proposal
text:
This project encompassed both collaborative and individual components. As a team, we developed a product concept and identified a dataset relevant to our idea. We were required to present our product pitch in the form of a video presentation, which I have embedded on the first page of the PDF above containing my individual report.
The product needed to be an application designed for students, incorporating elements of finance, innovation, and enterprise. On the individual side, each team member was tasked with detailing the technical aspects of our pitch, including data analysis, identifying the market gap, understanding our target customers, and outlining the product’s sales strategy. While some aspects could be shared among team members, it was essential to include our own unique contributions within the assignment.
Below are key snippets of code processed from a dataset that supported our team’s decision-making process in identifying the market gap, which I primarily analyzed for my team:

Importing Data and Intial Analysis


Importing librarys
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns




Importing dataset
df = pd.read_csv("UberDataset.csv")

Data Cleaning


Checked & removed duplicates
duplicated_data = df[df.duplicated()]
print(duplicated_data.shape)

df = df.drop_duplicates(keep='first')


(1, 7)




Encode categorical variables using one-hot encoding
data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(df, columns=['category', 'purpose'], drop_first=True)




Converted date columns into date time
df["start_date"] = pd.to_datetime(df["start_date"], errors="coerce")
df["end_date"] = pd.to_datetime(df["end_date"], errors="coerce")




Handling missing values
# Handle missing values by dropping rows with missing 'start' or 'stop' and filling 'purpose' with 'unknown'
df.dropna(subset=['start', 'stop'], inplace=True)
df['purpose'] = df['purpose'].fillna("Unknown") 




Feature engineering, created new column for trip date
df["date"] = df["start_date"].dt.date




Ensured the dataset is sorted by date
df = df.sort_values('start_date')
df.set_index('start_date', inplace=True)

Plot trip frequency over time plot code
plt.figure(figsize=(11, 7))
sns.lineplot(x=df["date"].value_counts().sort_index().index,
             y=df["date"].value_counts().sort_index().values, marker="o")
plt.xlabel("date")
plt.ylabel("Number of Trips")
plt.title("Uber Trips Over Time")
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()











Top 10 most common pickup and drop-off locations plot code
top_pickups = df["start"].value_counts().head(10)
top_dropoffs = df["stop"].value_counts().head(10)

fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(9, 3))

sns.barplot(x=top_pickups.values, y=top_pickups.index, ax=axes[0], palette="Blues_r", hue=top_pickups.index, dodge=False)  
axes[0].set_title("Top 10 Pickup Locations")
axes[0].set_xlabel("Number of Trips")
axes[0].legend([],[], frameon=False)  
sns.barplot(x=top_dropoffs.values, y=top_dropoffs.index, ax=axes[1], palette="Greens_r", hue=top_dropoffs.index, dodge=False)
axes[1].set_title("Top 10 Drop-off Locations")
axes[1].set_xlabel("Number of Trips")
axes[1].legend([],[], frameon=False) 

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()











code for plot of count of trips by purpose
trip_purpose_counts = df["purpose"].value_counts()
plt.figure(figsize=(9, 5))
sns.barplot(x=trip_purpose_counts.index, y=trip_purpose_counts.values, hue=trip_purpose_counts.index, palette="Oranges", legend=False) 
plt.xlabel("Purpose of Trip")
plt.ylabel("Number of Trips")
plt.title("Trip Purpose Distribution")
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()

#Main purpose isn't known but second is a meeting which could be relative to commuting with commuting having little, below we see it has the highest average distance by purpose, which backs up our product in relation a student carpooling application which would aid in their commute.











code for plot of average trip distance by purpose
avg_miles_purpose = df.groupby("purpose")["miles"].mean().sort_values()
plt.figure(figsize=(9, 5))
sns.barplot(x=avg_miles_purpose.index, y=avg_miles_purpose.values, hue=avg_miles_purpose.index, dodge=False, palette="Blues", legend=False)  
plt.xlabel("Purpose of Trip")
plt.ylabel("Average Miles Traveled")
plt.title("Average Trip Distance by Purpose")
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()











Plot for hourly trip analysis of the day
df["hour"] = df.index.hour
plt.figure(figsize=(9, 5))
sns.countplot(x=df["hour"], hue=df["hour"], dodge=False, palette="coolwarm", legend=False) 
plt.xlabel("Hour of the Day")
plt.ylabel("Number of Trips")
plt.title("Trips by Hour of the Day")
plt.show()
#hours align similarly with college hours.











Code for plot of Trip category to number of trips distribution
plt.figure(figsize=(9, 5))
sns.countplot(x=df["category"], hue=df["category"], palette="viridis", legend=False)
plt.xlabel("Trip Category")
plt.ylabel("Number of Trips")
plt.title("Business vs Personal Trips")
plt.show()

title: Future Pathway: Pursuing a Career in Technology
text:
With a foundation in Business with Data Analytics and a growing passion for technology, my future is shaped by both strategic intent and hands-on experience. From early exposure to roles in software development through mentorship with Innovative Communities, to gaining practical insights during the Dell Technologies STEM Aspire programme, I’ve developed a vison of building a career in the technology sectory.
Motivated by the rapidly evolving technological landscape, I had intentionally chosen Data Analytics as my university specialization within Business Studies, completing modules such as Programming & Visualization, Machine Learning & Advanced Python, Workflow & Data Management, Econometrics, and Forecasting. Moreover, outside of university, I completed courses in software development. These experiences have strengthened my technical foundation and reaffirmed my ambition to pursue a career as a software developer.
My professional growth is also reflected in my academic projects, developing a Quarto-based ePortfolio hosted on GitHub Pages (this website). This not only sharpened my web development and version control skills but also allowed me to showcase my journey and capabilities in a structured, industry-relevant format.
Looking ahead, I plan to develop more code-based projects and persue courses around the technology space as part of continuing professional development (CPD), bridging the gap between my business acumen and technical skill set
Ultimately, I am driven by a commitment to continuous learning, adaptability, and a passion for solving complex problems. My goal is to thrive in a dynamic tech environment where I can contribute meaningfully and continously learn.

Find out more about my interests, community engagement and growths →
Explore the short courses I’ve completed →


 Back to top

title: Creating an Ethical Theory
text:
As part of the Business and Professional Ethics module, we were given a pair assignment. This task challenged us to reflect deeply on ethical theories covered in class, including those of Aristotle, Kant, and Bentham. Our objective was to design a unique ethical framework that answers the fundamental question: “Why do we act?”
Through collaborative dialogue and thoughtful exchange of ideas, my partner and I explored philosophical principles to craft a coherent and creative ethical theory. This process involved naming our theory, defining its core inspiration, critically comparing it with existing theories, and demonstrating its application in a real-world scenario. Deep thinking, creativity, and teamwork were key elements of this assignment, culminating in the development of our theory: Unified Fulfillment Theory (UFT).


 Back to top

title: Analysis Comparison Modernization and Dependency Theories
text:
This project had critically explored the contrasting perspectives of the Stages of Growth (“modernization”) and Dependency schools of thought regarding economic development. It examined the historical, social, and political contexts that shaped each theory, highlighting how these foundations inform their differing understandings of development processes. The analysis also delves into their core arguments and policy recommendations, drawing attention to the unique implications of each perspective for global economic strategies.


 Back to top

title: Analysis of the Impact of Technological Change and Shifting Consumer Behaviour on the Global Automobile Industry
text:
This assignment involved exploring how advancements in technology and evolving consumer preferences influence the global automobile industry’s structure, strategies, and market dynamics.


 Back to top
